The vImage library provides a user-defined half-precision gamma type and constant half-precision gamma types, such as
. Use a half-precision gamma type when creating a gamma function for image data that’s intended for conversion to 8-bit. The half-precision gamma types work with floating-point values in the range
The gamma correction functions that use a
object are symmetric around zero. That is, they treat negative values as if they’re positive, and restore the sign after applying the exponent.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.

A type for a gamma function.
Convert an RGB image to discrete luminance and chrominance channels, and apply color and contrast treatments.

abstract.text: A user-defined gamma value with full-precision calculation.
A user-defined gamma value with half-precision calculation.
A half-precision calculation using the sRGB standard gamma value of 2.2.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Applies a gamma function to an 8-bit planar image to produce a 32-bit planar image.
Applies a gamma function to a PlanarF image.
Applies a gamma function to a 32-bit planar image to produce an 8-bit planar image.
